hey! im autistic and i think the best way to put it is Extremely Blunt. Like just a I need quiet to work and sometimes i may chat with other people i would love to have a 15 minute conversation with you at the end of class! when we do that you can have my divided attention!

Library seems like a great job environment because its almost always low sensory demand and i can reliably pass and non-autistic in those types of places. It also seems like a very if x - do y type of job.
its a texture thing for me lol! i recently found the light with cinnamon toast crunch!

ive been in college for 3 years (i graduated at 15! it was a lot of work but super worth it!) and everyone has been super accommodating! i have separate testing and i can type my notes and record lectures! (i use a program called sonocent that lets me import slides and put the audio over them.)
its a very low sensory demand environment with a routine/algorithmic task so i think im going to do great! :D
yep! my job was, when the Chalupas were low someone would tell me and i would make the shells. anyone would have to do that job.

I was working on fryer (fryologist was my official title lol) so my workflow was
do a maintenance task (dropping and prepping cinnamon twists)
when someone asked drop a special item, this has a 60-80 second wiggle room of stop what im doing and drop the item,
rinse repeat
I feel like youre very right. ive applied for an internship lab tech position at the vaccine research place near me. (Vaccines are my special interest! and we all know about autism and vaccines! /j)
oops! i meant to put a not in front of it! ive known the head librarian since i was little so im going to talk to her and i think that will be a much better job!
OOPS!! i meant reasonable! i goofed big time!

lets go to the movies! i dont need that much support today!!

i think its a skill but also an easily practiced one!
me and my S/O do a lot of non-sexual consent (can i complain a minute can i eat some of that would it be alright if i stood up while we talk?)
it transfers wonderfully because its already in our day to day!
so uh, thats a pro tip for ya!
also note: it doesnt just extend to romantic/sexual! practice casual consent with:
kids! (could i look at your drawings?)
friends! (oo! could i have a taste of that!)
coworkers! (im swamped would i be alright if i gave this report to you?) ((this one is great to follow with a treat like coffee or snack even a stress ball))
it means in this thread have a wonderful day!

hey op, you are going through intense stress right now and crying in front of someone is a lot healthier than to break things and scream.
You can not control your emotions but you can control how you display them. You went for a healthy cry in front of someone i trust You did nothing wrong.
I think, like others have said, that if you feel like you want to address it its best to do it in a thank you than a im sorry
My second thought is that, the best thing for my relationship was seeing my boyfriend openly and honestly express his emotions not just in front of me but other people.
If for whatever reason she did find out, i dont believe she would see it as a negative.
You can name and express your emotions in a way that doesnt hurt anyone which is a lot more than other people our age not just guys. Its a positive trait
Source: im an 18yo girl whos been through a lot of emotional control therapy

hey! its going to be ok! its very scary right now but just stay in contact with your doctor! From a relationship stand point and a public health stand point my advice is to tell her!
as for your health, your highest chance of staying healthy is from talking to your doctor A Lot! go in more often than anyone else you know. talk to your doc if anything feels off.
Responding to my own comment but perhaps try to send a thinking of you text! or if she has a favorite food you can make/get easy bring it to her?

EDIT: OOPS I DIDNT SEE WHERE YOU MENTIONED LOVE LANGUAGES
hey OP! a great way to help smooth communication in any relationship romantic or not is to think about something called love languages!
There are so many ways to tell someone you care about them! The main ones (with examples) are
Touch (holding hands, arm around shoulders)
Gifts (My BFF knows I love heart shaped rocks so when she sees one she gives it to me)
Words (Poems or thinking of you texts)
Quality Time (going for a walk, deep conversations, board games)
Acts Of Service (my mom saw my tires needed air so she did it for me)
if she isnt responding when you do one (like touch) maybe try another one (send her a kind text)

I know my situation was extreme but being comfortable with sex at 14 led to me being kidnapped and sex trafficked. You should not and truly can not consent to sex at 14. Theres a reason you have parents and its to stop shit like this.

AITA for demanding unreasonable accommodation at work?
WRITING.TEXT:
Im 18F and just got fired from my first job (taco bell) because i requested unreasonable accommodations.
To preface I have autism. I asked for the following things
-Say my name before talking to me so i know that im being spoken to. something like (name) please drop 6 chalupas
-Give me specific instructions please clean this area vs it would be nice if this area was cleaner
- Understand that sometimes im not aware of my own body language. if im standing with my shoulders to my ears its not that im upset but that it just feels good.
my boss as she was telling me i had to quit that it was because she felt that these would cause the workflow to be interrupted and were unreasonable.
so AITA?
UPDATE:
ive decided im going to keep my head down but remember that these are not ridiculous requests for my next job. Ive been considering applying for a page job at my local library. i grew up doing programs there so the staff knows me well.

[Family/Friends] My mom made a small gesture and it meant so much to me
WRITING.TEXT:
ok so i was crying and super upset last week that ive never gotten to go to pride (talking to a friend in front of my mom)
now, my mom is on the fence about the whole lgbt thing. she doesnt quite understand.
so today she comes in and tells me that we are going to the ball game on tuesday next week. im like ok! cool!
she tells me too look up the event (every night theres some promotion like 10 cent hot dogs or free ball cap)
and its pride night.
i tell her and she says i know. you seemed so sad and im your mom so i have to make you feel better

WIBTA if i offered to wash and style a friends natural (black) hair when im white?
WRITING.TEXT:
I have a friend ive known from childhood for maybe 13-14 years now. Shes from a family that isnt neglectful but still doesnt pay much attention to her.
Her dad is black but her mother is white and her mother never tried to help her with her hair. She normally wears it back because people like to try to touch it without asking.
Shes the type of person who loves to be touched and cared for by friends but her hair is off limits to touch to most people but she doesnt mind when i play with it absently (the playing w/ hair is a teen girl thing i know) but her hair is kind of, well, unhealthy because she doesnt know how to care for it.
Like most people I get into a youtube rabbit hole and when I was doing that a month ago I saw some women with hair like hers doing styles and curls by washing and wrapping it.
The styles dont last more than a week so i was thinking of offering to style her hair because shes been struggling with mental health and i know that when i struggle new hair gets me out of a funk.
In the moments im not amazed watching the videos im aware of this its not for me feeling. The women in the videos tend to jokingly poke fun at white people hair tutorials and styles. I thought about the fact that that im a white person and i dont want to be presumptuous and come across like a racist asshole because i assumed that i knew what was best for her.

WRITING.TITLE: What SCPs would you consider capital "A" Art?
WRITING.TEXT:
While all SCPs are art in that they are an expression of creativity there are some that go the extra mile and hit you hard and leave you thinking. What are some that hit those marks for you?
#x200B;
Examples of art
* Twilight * Zentangle drawings * Harry Potter
Examples of "A" Art
* Dante's Inferno * "Saturn Devouring His Son" by Francisco Goya * Fahrenheit 451

WRITING.TITLE: Oof!
I got bullied into an MLM at 16. Im almost 18 now and still stuck.
WRITING.TEXT:
Shortly after my 16 birthday I went to a fashion show at a local college. The first important thing that makes me feel nasty is that it was a first major manic episode in my bipolar history. There was an MLM called Sseko there. They gave me the usual MLM garbage but being 16 and extremely manic I joined the start up fee was $300 and I was told that if I borrowed it from my mother she wouldnt miss it.
I was in nowhere near a stable state. I was hospitalized 3 days after the purchase, and this is the second wild part, my big sis came to see me in the hospital. Being under 18 she lied and said she was my aunt. I had never seen this woman before in my life. I was extremely psychotic and detached from reality. She told me I could sell to the other teens in the ward with me.
I was in the hospital for the next 8 months. I am finally out and stable. Im extremely stuck in this company and feel like shit. They call me on a regular basis and harass me through social media. moral of the story, FUCK MLMs

I'm making a radio drama style podcast and have a transwoman as a main character so i need a trans voice actor (More information inside)
WRITING.TEXT:
I have been working for almost a year now with the script for an fictional audio podcast. I have a transwoman as one of my lead character and would feel it's disrespectful to have her voiced by a ciswoman. I am trans myself (agender) and understand how important representation is. I have been informed that for the most part that, without voice training, voice pitch doesn't change so it doesnt matter if you are out or not, pretransition or fully. sorry if this is a ramble.
TLDR: i need a transwoman voice actor PM if interested.

WRITING.TITLE: im a cripple with crippling dysphoria

WRITING.TEXT:
Coming from the perspective of a sexual abuse survivor, it could be entirely possible she has traumatic experiences that she may be denying or repressing.
However, if her actions hurt you she is responsible. No matter if she is mentally ill or not.

I have bipolar disorder and was in a manic state. The guy hit on me and my girlfriend didn't even cross my mind till I saw her and thought she would be proud of me. She wasn't. She saw the emotional state I was in and understood, but, for some reason I broke up with her. I don't blame my disorder for my actions but I'm glad I got hospitalized shortly after.
